Ted Kazcynski.Ideology: Anti-government, anti-technology. His philosophy resembles primitivism and green anarchism
Ted Kazcynski.Social Media: Sent letters to the New York Times

Timothy McVeigh, Terry Nichols.Social Media: Letters to sent to News Outlets
Timothy McVeigh, Terry Nichols.Influences:
"Attack was made on the second anniversary of the end of the Waco Siege. McVeigh had expressed anger at the government's handling of the Ruby Ridge standoff and Waco siege.

He's also reported to have joined a KKK branch in Arkansas and blamed equal opportunity laws for his lack of job prospects. "

Anders Breivik.Target: Oslo government offices and Workers' Youth League (AUF) summer camp in Utoya.
Anders Breivik.Social Media: Active on Stormfront (neo-nazi website) and Document.no (Islam-critical Norwegian site).
Anders Breivik.Influences: Sections of his manifesto copied from the Unabomber's manifesto.

Brunon Kwiecie\u0144.Social Media: Praised Anders Breivik, made anti government remarks online

Dylann Roof.Ideology: White supremacy, race motivated, igniting a "race war"
Dylann Roof.Social Media: Personal website. Active on Stormfront, Daily Stormer
Dylann Roof.Affiliations: Generated a right-wing group, the "bowl patrol", after his haircut
Dylann Roof.Influences: Reportedly influenced by the killing of Trayvon Martin and the 2015 Baltimore protests. In his manifesto, he reports being self-radicalized after googling "black on white crime"

Alexandre Bissonnette.Target: Islamic Cultural Centre of Quebec City
Alexandre Bissonnette.Influences: Told police he was motivated by the 2014 shooting of a Canadian soldier by a Lybian-Canadian Islam convert with addiction and mental health issues.

Devon Arthurs.Ideology: Converted to Islam, shot neo-nazi roommates in retaliation for mockery
Devon Arthurs.Affiliations: Attomwaffen Division, later Salafist National Socialist
Devon Arthurs.Influences: Claims to have been preventing further terrorist plots by Attomwaffen roommates

Darren Osborne.Influences: Turned against Muslims in the wake of the London Bridge attack on 3 June 2017.

Luca Traini.Influences: Said to have been motivated by the prior killing of an 18-year old girl, allegedly by an African asylum seeker.

Robert Bowers.Social Media: Gab, active on other right wing sites
Robert Bowers.Affiliations: Supporter of the Rise Above Movement (RAM) and Proud Boy, links to several neo-nazi organisations
Robert Bowers.Influences:
He wrote ""Screw your optics, I'm going in"" on Gab on the day of his attack, referencing the ongoing debate about the optics of white nationalism in the wake of the Charlottesville riot.

His writing also echoed Dylann Roof of the Charleston murders.

Brenton Tarrant.Social Media: Active on 8chan, 4chan, livestreamed attack on Facebook.
Brenton Tarrant.Affiliations: Connected with several right-wing organizations throughout the world, including European and Balkan nationalists, Azov Division, among others.
Brenton Tarrant.Influences: Wrote the names of previous offenders (Traini, Bisonnette, Darren Osbourne) as well as the victims of murders by Islamic extremists (Ebba Åkerlund, victim in the 2017 Stockholm truck attack) on his weapons and magazines

John Earnest.Social Media: Active on 8chan, 4chan, livestreamed attack on Facebook (attempted)
John Earnest.Affiliations: Online radicalisation, member of the Orthodox Presbyterian Church.
John Earnest.Influences: Manifesto claims to have been inspired by the Christchurch shooter and Robert Bowers.

Patrick Crusius.Target: Largely Hispanic shoppers at a Walmart
Patrick Crusius.Affiliations: Supporter of the Great Replacement theory
Patrick Crusius.Influences: Manifesto claims to have been inspired by the Christchurch shooter

Philip Manshaus.Social Media: Endchan. Attempted livestream on Facebook Live.
Philip Manshaus.Affiliations: Tried to join Nordic Resistance Movement. Supporter of Nazi collaboration.
Philip Manshaus.Influences:
Posted messages on Endchan praising the Christchurch shooter. 

Also shared a meme depicting Tarrant, Patrick Crusius, and John Earnest as ""chads"".

Stephan Balliet.Influences: His manifesto referred to Breivik and the Christchurch, El Paso attackers as 'heroes'

Kankaanp\u00e4\u00e4 Terror Plot.Affiliations: Attomwaffen Division Finland, links to Nordic Resistance Movement
Kankaanp\u00e4\u00e4 Terror Plot.Influences: Bomb materials and method copied from Anders Breivik

Tobias Rathjen.Social Media: Telegram; had previously contacted the authorities with about conspiracy theories
Tobias Rathjen.Influences:
"After the attack, the shooter went back to his apartment, killed his mother and then committed suicide. 

In addition to his racist and xenophobic motivations, the shooter also expressed his frustration at his lack of relationships with women."

Hugo Jackson.Influences:
"He quoted the perpetrator of the Christchurch attack at the beginning of his livestream.

Jackson was a self-described white supremacist despite being non-white."

Payton Gendron.Target: Tops Friendly Markets, supermarket in predominantly black neighbourhood.
Payton Gendron.Social Media: Livestream on Twitch, active on the Daily Stormer and Discord. Kept an online diary.
Payton Gendron.Influences: On his rifle he wrote the names of previous killers Dylann Roof, Robert Bowers, Brenton Tarrant, and John Earnest, the acronym SYGAOWN (Stop Your Genocide Against Our White Nations)

Robert \"Bobby\" Crimo III.Affiliations: Supporter of former President Donald Trump, frequented far-right gatherings
Robert \"Bobby\" Crimo III.Influences: Focus on aesthetics and performance rather than ideology. Copied several online activities of previous mass shooters.

Juraj Kraj\u010d\u00edk.Ideology: White nationalism, far-right extremism, anti-LGBT, antisemitism
Juraj Kraj\u010d\u00edk.Social Media: Livestream on Twitter, active on Twitter, Telegram and 4chan.
Juraj Kraj\u010d\u00edk.Influences: Manifesto celebrates other far-right shooters, including Anders Breivik, Brenton Tarrant and John Earnest

Anderson Lee Aldrich.Social Media: Hosted his own neo-Nazi website, sharing violent and racist content, including video from the 2022 Buffalo Shooting.
Anderson Lee Aldrich.Influences: Aldrich allegedly created a website that included a video that advocated killing civilians to "cleanse society" and linked to a "brother website" that had hosted footage of the 2022 Buffalo shooting

Ryan Palmeter.Influences: Palmeter was wearing a vest with a Rhodesian Army patch on it, just like Dylann Roof and the Christchurch shooter before him. Also referenced the Oklahoma City Bombings and the Turner Diaries.
